result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:36 AM Defendant Todd S. Patterson in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Todd S. Patterson.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Arraignment scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Demand For Discovery, Notice of Intent To Use Statements of Defendant and DNA Evidence

3:15 PM Defendant Todd S. Patterson in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Todd S. Patterson.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin appearing specially for Attorney Matt Lantta. Preliminary Hearing questionnaire and waiver filed with the Court. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. The State requests 30 days to file the information. Defense requests matter to be set over for DA PTC. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
from the Circuit Court regarding Court Appointed Attorney

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM Defendant Todd S. Patterson in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not retained counsel. The defendant has not filled out application for Court appointed Attorney. Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney. The Court will give defendant more time to obtain counsel. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:30 PM Defendant Todd S. Patterson in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. DE does not have an attorney. DE plans to speak with an attorney on Friday, August 5th, 2022. DE waived time limits. Matter set over for DE to obtain counsel. Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Violation: OWI 4th
Issuing Agency: GCSD
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. 
May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. 
May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license on a public highway or roadway in the State of Wisconsin.

1:19 PM Defendant Todd S. Patterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in Court for defendant. Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Bond set. Matter set over.
